channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Go after Meta and Google': Trump reacts to censorship on assassination content
item.description: Former president Donald Trump Tuesday reacted to the reported censorship on content on the assassination bid on him by Meta and Google. Social media users pointed out that that Facebook was labeling the image of Donald Trump pumping his fist in the air after the assassination bid in Pennsylvania as an "altered photo". Meta Public Affairs director Dani Lever admitted that it was an error triggered by a separate version of the image.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Our last chance': Venezuelan youth weigh leaving after election result
item.description: University graduate Jorge Salcedo sees no future in Venezuela after President Nicolas Maduro's contested re-election. Salcedo, disheartened by alleged electoral fraud and violence between supporters, considers joining the millions who have already left the country amid its economic and political turmoil. He fears that the young generation will continue to emigrate if the regime persists.

item.title: Actor 'shocked' seeing grocery store in Africa. 'I was lied to,' she says after backlash
item.description: Comedian Tiffany Haddish has been slammed for a viral TikTok video in which she is seen expressing shock that Africa has grocery stores. Now she has defended her viral video and said she was showing it to the world that they were taught wrong things about Africa.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Turkish President Erdogan could end up like Saddam Hussein: Israel
item.description: Israeli Foreign Minister Israel Katz warned Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan about facing a fate similar to Saddam Hussein if he intervened in the Gaza conflict. Erdogan suggested Turkey could enter Israel to aid Palestinians, drawing criticism from Katz and Israeli opposition leader Yair Lapid. The international community is closely monitoring the escalating tensions between Israel and Turkey.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Doug Emhoff shines in campaign trail while Melania Trump remains absent'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel protests: What sparked attacks on IDF bases and clashes in prison facilities?
item.description: In Israel, tensions flared as far-right lawmaker Zvi Sukkot and demonstrators stormed military bases to prevent soldiers from being detained over alleged abuse of a Palestinian prisoner. The protests spotlighted divisions within Israel and posed challenges to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's coalition. Both Netanyahu and President Isaac Herzog condemned the incursion, calling it a dangerous act.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What Donald Trump thinks about JD Vance's 'childless cat ladies' comment
item.description: ​Amid speculations that former president Donald Trump, the Republican nominee for the president, may replace JD Vance as Vance emerged as a controversial figure because of what he said and believed, Trump said Vance just loves family and there is nothing wrong in saying that. But Trump's feelings about 'childless cat ladies' are not so strong as he said he thinks not having children is "just as good" as having a family.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Gaza health ministry declares territory 'polio epidemic area'
item.description: The health ministry in Hamas-run Gaza has declared the Palestinian territory a "polio epidemic area," accusing Israel's military campaign of destroying health infrastructure, which it says led to the recurrence of the virus. Israel's campaign has killed 39,400 people so far in Gaza, according to the health ministry in the Hamas-run territory, which does not provide details of civilian and militant deaths.

item.title: Donald Trump atomic crazy, won't vote for him, says nephew: 'He's not racist but...'
item.description: ​Donald Trump's nephew Fred C Trump III came to news for his tell-all book in which he revealed that his uncle told him to let his disabled son die and then move to Florida. Now he said he would vote for Kamala Harris as Trump is 'atomic crazy' and everyone knows that in the family. But if his uncle wins and he is invited to the inauguration, he said he would attend.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Lara Trump says Kamala Harris reminds her of designer 'trash bag'
item.description: Donald Trump's daughter-in-law Lara Trump who is also the co-chair of the Republican National Committee said Kamala Harris reminds her of a designer trash bag. She accused the mainstream media of trying to rewrite history and propping up Kamala Harris as an "amazing political figure". "It reminds me of a bag that a very famous designer designed. This was several years ago and it was literally a trash bag.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Kamala Harris quieter than electric car': Bill Maher's clip viral. Watch
item.description: A clip of comedian and commentator Bill Maher shredding vice president Kamala Harris to pieces has gone viral as Kamala's campaign has picked up against Donald Trump a week after President Joe Biden opted out of the presidential race. Bill Maher was one of the loudest voices against Biden contesting the election. But he didn't spare Kamala Harris either as he called Kamala's role as the vice president 'quieter than electric car' in a video.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections: Vice President Kamala Harris' campaign attracts record 360,000 volunteers
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Race for Harris's running mate narrows as Roy Cooper & Gretchen Whitmer opt out
item.description: Since vice president Harris emerged as the Democratic frontrunner about a week ago, following President Joe Biden's decision to end his campaign, the crucial choice of a vice presidential nominee has taken center stage. Harris is considering a list of candidates, primarily white males, who could help balance her ticket and broaden her appeal to a larger group of voters.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Protesters target Israeli team at 2024 Paris Olympics, chant ‘heil Hitler’ during match
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Australia's foreign minister says Russia-North Korea defense deal is 'risky for the world'
item.description: Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong visited the Korean border and criticized the defence pact between North Korea and Russia, calling it destabilizing and risky. She also condemned North Korea's missile tests. Wong met with South Korean officials to discuss countermeasures against North Korea and Russia's military partnership, highlighting concerns over regional security and escalating tensions.

item.title: Pakistan beggar found unconscious with over PKR 5 lakh, Saudi passport in pocket
item.description: An elderly beggar was discovered unconscious on Khushab Road in Pakistan's Sargodha district with over Rs 0.5 million in his pocket by the Rescue 1122 team. He had PKR 534,000 and a passport showing multiple trips to Saudi Arabia. ​​Upon discharge from the hospital, he retrieved his money and belongings, according to Geo News.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who Is Tim Walz? Minnesota governor stirring interest in Kamala Harris’ VP search
